column2: The  dock statements of the appellants have been considered by the trial

column2: It  has  been  clearly  established  by  evidence  that  the  accused  were  well

column1: known to the witnesses PW 1 and PW 2 as they were from the same area. In such
circumstances there was no need to hold an identification parade and no prejudice
has been caused to the appellants, by not holding an Identification Parade.

column2: PW  2  has  testified  naming  the  seven  accused  who  were  at  the  place  of

column2: he common object of unlawful assembly alleged in count one and two

column1: are, causing the death of Rizmi and the attempted murder of PW 2 respectively.
It  is  up  to  the  prosecution  to  prove  that  these  offences    were  committed  in
